payload.name: probabilistic-logic
payload.core: Blend logical structure (relations, rules, quantifiers) with probabilistic uncertainty. Uses probabilistic programming with constraints to reason about structured worlds under uncertainty. More expressive than plain Bayesian models for relational domains.

out.d: conclusions over structured worlds with uncertainty
effects of rules with probability weights

proc: define logical structure: entities, relations, rules, quantifiers
assign probabilities to base facts and rules
compute posterior over structured world states
extract relational predictions with confidence bounds
check: model validated against known ground truth

diff.bayesian: adds logical structure to probability vs pure distributions
diff.deductive: incorporates uncertainty vs binary truth values
diff.fuzzy-logic: principled probability vs graded membership functions

ex.sit: Knowledge graph with uncertain entity types and relations. Need to infer missing links.
steps: define entities: Person, Organization; relations: worksFor, locatedIn
add rule: worksFor(X,Y) ^ locatedIn(Y,Z) => likelyIn(X,Z) with P=0.8
validate: check against known residence data
ex.insight: logical rules propagate uncertainty while preserving relational structure
